gurmukhi: AYsy hlwXuD kop khXo qb jwdv bIr sBY imil Dwey ] jo ieh swmuih Awie Ary giH ko qyaU jIvq jwn n pwey ]
transliteration: Aise Halaayudh Kop Kahyo Tab Jaadav Beer Sabhai Mil(i) Dhaae|| Jo Eh Saamuh(i) Aaedare Grah(i) Ko Teoo Jeevat Jaan Na Paae||
translation: When Balram exhibited his ire in this manner, then all the Yadava warriors fell upon the enemy whosoever now came before them, could not return alive; all those who were standing there,

gurmukhi: Aaur ijqy qh TwFy huqy As lY brCy prsy gih Awey ] joir iBry joaU lwj Bry Air ko br kY iqn Gwie lgwey ]1225]
transliteration: Aur Jite Tah Thaadhe Houte As Lai Barchhe Parse Gadh Aae|| Jor(i) Bhire Jooo Laaj Bhare Ar(i) Ko Bar Kai Tin Ghaae Lagade||1225||
translation: They started moving with their axes and lances; keeping into consideration their honour and custom, they struck blows on the enemy with full strength.1225.

gurmukhi: Aimt isMG Aiq kop hÍY Aimq clwey bwn ] hir sYnw qm ijau BjI sr mwno kir Bwn ]1226]
transliteration: Amit Singh At(i) Kop Hvai Amit Chadhaae Baan|| Har(sainaa Tam Jio Bhajiar Maano Kar(i) Bhaan||1226||
translation: When Amit Singh, in great fury, discharged innumerable arrows, then the enemy’s fled like the darkness running away in bewilderment before the sun.1226.

gurmukhi: jwq Bjy jduvI pRiqnw rn mY muslI ieh BwNq pcwry ] C`qRin ky kul mY aupjy ikh BwNiq prwvq ho blu hwry ]
transliteration: Jaat Bhaje Jaduvipratinaa Ran Mai Mouslieh Bhaant Pachdare Chhattran(i) Ke Kul Mai Oupje Kih Bhant(i) Paraavat Ho Bal(u) Hdare||
translation: Balram said to the running away Yadava army, “O warriors born in the clans of Kshatriyas ! why are you running away?

gurmukhi: AwXuD Cwfq ho kr qy fru mwn Gno ibn hI Air mwry ] qRws kro n kCU rn mY jb lau qn mY iQru pRwn hmwry ]1227]
transliteration: Ooyudh Chhaadat Ho Kar Te Dar(u) Maan Ghano Bin Hiar(u) Mdare|| Traas Daro Na Kachhodh Ran Mai Jab Lau Tan Mai Thir(u) Praan Hamdare||1227||
translation: “You are dropping your weapons without killing the enemy; you should have not fear of war, till I am alive.”1227.

gurmukhi: kop AXoDn mY hlI suBtin khXo pcwr ] Aimt isMG ko Goir kY khXo lyhu qum mwr ]1228]
transliteration: Kop Ayodhan Mai Halisoubhatan(i) Kahyo Pachaar|| Amit Singh Ko Gher(i) Kai Kahyo Lehu Toum Maar||1228||
translation: Balram in anger, caressing the warriors, said, “Kill Amit Singh by besieging him.”1228.

gurmukhi: Awies pwie qbY muslI chUM Er cmUM llkwr prI ] Aiq kop BrI Apuny mn mY Aimtys ky swmuih Awie ArI ]
transliteration: Oois Paae Tabai Mouslichahoon Or Chamoond Lalkaar Daree|| At(i) Kop Bhariapoune Man Mai Amites Ke Saamuh(i) Aaedaree||
translation: Receiving the command of Balram, his army fell upon the enemy challenging him from all the four directions and filled with rage resisted in front of Amit Singh;

gurmukhi: bhu ju`D AXoDn bIc BXo kib sXwm khY nhI nYku frI ] niRp bIr srwsin lY kr bwn GnI pRqnw ibnu qRwn krI ]1229]
transliteration: Bahu Juddh Ayodhan Beech Bhayo Kabi Syaam Kahai Nahinaik(u) Daree|| Nrip Beer Saraasan(i) Lai Kar Baan Ghanipratnaa Bin(u) Traan Daree||1229||
translation: There was dreadful fighting in the battlefield, but the army did not fear even slightly; the king Amit Singh, taking his bow in his hand, killed many warriors of the army and made the army helpless.1229.
